intro: Pinalia lancilabris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pinalia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic plants.
